name: Alaska Garden Gate B & B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Because of the honest reviews of people from Trip Advisor we found:
reviews.title: Excellent B&B in Palmer w/great room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Alaska Garden Gate B&B in Palmer.
reviews.title: Perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: Fabulous king size bed (this was the most comfy bed I slept in on my Alaska adventure), in downstairs large room w/sauna tub, separate shower/bathroom, kitchenette, lots of space w/great view of trees and the mat su valley, excellent breakfast: eggs, bacon, sausage, homemade large waffles, fresh fruit, juices.
reviews.title: Very nice and convenient stay! wonderful view!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The lovely host Karen told us lots of interesting stories about the people who live in Alaska...(Eskimo Ice Cream anyone??), and about Hachter Pass....a must drive to spot.
reviews.title: Very nice B & B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would book with her again, nothing negative happened.
reviews.title: Would not recommend. No hostess. Lousy breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Delightful and very friendly host. Clean room which is an absolute must. Just a few minor complaints; I travel with my own shampoo and bath gels but I do expect hand soap to wash hands after visiting the bathroom, there was none until my husband relocated the dish washing detergent to the bathroom and we purchased soap for the following day. A pancake with a side bowl stuffed with gray steaming brown n serve sausage hot out of the microwave does not a breakfast make. The alternative I selected was from a bowl of yogurt with what I thought was fresh fruit until I bit down on a frozen blueberry right out of the freezer. Not sure where the wonderful breakfast was but we didn't see it. Skipped out early and headed straight to Ihop for some protein to prepare for a very physically active day the following morning. The "no locked doors" was something we found a bit odd but others may not. We are long time Alaska residents and understand the concept of "we're safe out here in the woods" in "theory" but I would like to be comfortable leaving a laptop or other personal items in a room. Not a fan of two unlocked doors to gain entry to the room I am renting (one via an outside entrance), this may just be our own personal idiosyncrasy. We are accustomed to removing shoes upon entry to a home here in Alaska as we do this in our own home but I thought it odd that we were greeted by the enormous, furry, husky family dog as we came upstairs to approach the breakfast table (barefooted to be respectful of the no shoes rule). Didn't really mind the dog being there but I would have worn my shoes to breakfast had I known and think it should be mentioned (if it was I didn't see it) in the advertisement that there is a family dog that might make some people feel uncomfortable. Did the dog remove his/her shoes ? All in all it was a comfortable bed, clean and served our purpose for the two nights we spent there. The host is very friendly and kind and this review should be taken as constructive criticism only.
reviews.title: Very Clean, Friendly Host, breakfast ?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Stayed 1 night after visiting Denali . The place is located at a hill and it has a pleasant feel about it. The cabins were very nicely decorated and the garden was nice.
reviews.title: Heavenly!
Seemed lovely at the start
reviews.text: It was very clean and had a kitchen and all toiletries needed in the bathroom.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Karen was really nice and made sure we had everything we need.
reviews.title: Beautiful Property, Grumpy Innkeeper

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was at the main house and we had pancakes,bacon,yogurt , apple juice, coffee or tea.
reviews.title: Great Breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We came to see as much as we could in a week, and we spent long days out in the great wild country doing everything—we took a full-day ATV tour to a glacier, we took a flightseeing trip around Mt. McKinley, we panned for gold at Hatcher Pass, and guides took us hiking on a glacier and ice-climbing. That was all so awesome and we loved the adventures and seeing moose and eagles. We came back so jazzed but so tired, too, and this B&B was a great place to rest and refuel for the next day!
reviews.title: Fantastic Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled solo
reviews.text: Our room was the budget one and we thought we were getting a steal of a deal to have everything else that the other people in more expensive rooms had too—fantastic views, great breakfasts, really nice place.
reviews.title: Descriptions are a little overstated, breakfast breads are frm mixes, eggs blan

likes.disliked: — Dog hair all over, breakfasts uninspired, stairs to bathroom

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We don’t mind sharing a bathroom, so we felt like we were getting away with murder to stay there for $79/night and get to sit and look out at a glacier and huge mountains right outside the view.
reviews.title: Hospitality Extraordinare!

likes.liked: — Views, grat hospitality by the owner, lovely setting
likes.disliked: — Location of the bathroom for our room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: A friend of mine and I went on a climbing and hiking trip to Hatcher Pass and we stayed here a few nights. We really enjoyed our visit at the Garden Gate. The rooms were clean, the views are outstanding, and the breakfast was great. Karen was an exceptional host. She is kind, interesting and very knowledgeable about the region. She shared a number of fascinating stories about the local culture which certainly added to the enjoyment of my trip. I would stay here again or recommend it to friends and family.
reviews.title: Great place to stay in Palmer

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Most of the rooms are little pre-fab cabins but they are spacious, clean, and nicely furnished. My only issue is the same one I have with ALL B & Bs: Way too much ceremony and stuff for breakfast. Just give me some coffee and corn flakes and let me get out. But maybe that's just me.
reviews.title: Nice quiet place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in one of the cabins, an impeccably clean, comfortable and well-furnished abode with a full kitchenette/sitting room. It's only lacking a coffee table or something in the sitting room; there's not quite enough table space for an extended stay.
reviews.title: Clean, gorgeous, friendly.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Karen's a fantastic proprietor. Calm, friendly, upfront and accomidating. And boyohboy, can she cook! Breakfasts are in the main house in a lovely room complete with a geriatric husky.
reviews.title: Planning our second visit!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's easy to get to-- really! pay close attention to her directions and forget your GPS until it's got the updated Trunk road re-alignment. and the addresses on Old Trunk road are reassigned.
reviews.title: Friendly host, clean room, useful suggestions

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We've enjoyed both stays here. Two years ago we stayed in the Forest Haven Guest Apartment and this trip we stayed in one of the luxury cottages Both times we enjoyed our stay. The rooms are very clean and nicely decorated. The view of Knik glacier from the luxury cottage is outstanding. The Forest Haven room has a nice view of a field of wildflowers. We enjoyed talking with Karen each morning and her homemade jam is awesome!
reviews.title: We've stayed her twice & plan on coming back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This home was priced correctly. Our host was amazing. Very loving and kind. The food was very nice and she allowed you to eat more if you wanted more. The bedroom had a jacuzzi in the bedroom living area. How different so I took advantage of enjoying a bath in the bedroom living area. I had to be quiet though, it was next to Karen's room and I did not want to bother her.
reviews.title: What a beautiful home and so pleasant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: Thank you to our host Karen and wonderful cook.
reviews.title: Lovely Host, beautiful setting, very clean and welcoming

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Eric and Debbie
reviews.title: Would stay here again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Honolulu, HI
reviews.title: Totally worth it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: This is a really really nice place! I stayed at the Alaska Garden Gate B&B for 2 days in late June 2008; I paid around $80 for my room (the cheapest room there), and was amazed at how nice the B&B was!
reviews.title: Wonderful B&B!

likes.liked: — Clean, friendly, quiet, and great value!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Karen - the owner - greeted me as I entered, and showed me around the B&B. The living room is huge and has an amazing view of the mountains and glacier, and features a computer with internet connection (if you're travelling without a laptop - there is free wireless internet if you have one), TV, and a couple of sofas. My room was big, spacious and clean. As I was in the cheapest room, I had to share the downstairs bathroom with another occupant, but this wasn't an issue at all, and the bathroom was clean and really nice. Other rooms have en-suite facilities and looked fantastic from what I could see when a door was left open!
reviews.title: Lovely B&B in good strategic city for vacation

likes.liked: — Relaxing evenings in the living room with gorgeous views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled solo
reviews.text: There are two dogs who live on the property; they were really friendly, and didn't get in the way at all. In fact, they really added to the "family" atmosphere of the place. Karen was a wonderful host, and as I told her, she runs an amazing, clean and friendly B&B. The prices are fantastic for Alaska, too!
reviews.title: Very nice place, and hearty breakfast

likes.liked: — Decor was very nice and tasteful, not overwhelming

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: The only downside is that you're not allowed in the B&B between 11am and 4pm for host privacy and cleaning, which is perfectly understandable (it's Karen's house, after all!) and besides - if you're on holiday in Alaska, you really shouldn't be inside during those hours anyway :-)
reviews.title: Not normally a “B&B person” but this was a great place

likes.liked: — relaxed, good wildlife, not stuck up
likes.disliked: — would have liked to stay longer

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed in the Hilton in Anchorage for five days prior to my stay here, and I can honestly say I enjoyed myself in this B&B far more. It's lovely, quiet, and safe, and amazing value for money!
reviews.title: Yum! We enjoyed marvelous breakfasts

description: Welcome to Alaska Garden Gate B&B and Cottages, between Palmer and Wasilla, Alaska, just 35 minutes north of Anchorage. Take in the breathtaking views of glaciers and mountains while relaxing in the comfortable setting of your private apartment. At Alaska Garden Gate, we offer seven cottages and five guest houses to accommodate the needs of everyone, from corporate travelers or international tourists. We feature Queen and King beds, fireplaces, Jacuzzis, full kitchens and living rooms, cable TV and free wireless internet. Additionally, a generous continental breakfast is provided in your kitchen to enjoy whenever you like. Make our B&B your home away from home while you explore on day-trips in all directions. From everyone at Alaska Garden Gate B&B and Cottages, we look forward to sharing our love of Alaska with you soon!
